###PART C
##a)
```{r}
cox_all <- coxph(Surv(years,status2)~drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT + platelets + prothrombin, data = pbc2)
cox_all
pbc2_no_na <- na.omit(pbc2)
cox_select <- stepAIC(coxph(Surv(years,status2)~drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT + platelets + prothrombin, data = pbc2_no_na),
        scope = list(upper = ~., lower= ~spiders), 
        direction = 'both')
cox_select
```

```{r}
#confidence intervals for the selected model
sum_cox_select <- summary(cox_select)
sum_cox_select$conf.int
```
```{r}
#local test of significance of spiders
linearHypothesis(cox_select, c("spidersYes"))
```
```{r}
#see practice session nÂ°2, exercise 2, question 5 (timecode of recording 1h25min)
#first those fit are the estimates of the survival curves on subsets depending on our binary variable spiders
fitYes <- survfit(coxph(Surv(years, status2) ~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
              data = subset(pbc2, spiders =='Yes')))
fitNo <- survfit(coxph(Surv(years, status2) ~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
              data = subset(pbc2, spiders =='No')))

#surfit fuction provides values only at times of observations, which are different for the two subsets, so we build a time scale with all time points
cumhaz <- data.frame(time = sort(c(fitYes$time, fitNo$time)))

cumhazYes <- data.frame(time = fitYes$time, cumhaz = fitYes$cumhaz)
cumhazNo <- data.frame(time = fitNo$time, cumhaz = fitNo$cumhaz)
#on unobserved times, the last observation is carried forward
cumhaz$chSpidersYes <- cumhazYes$cumhaz[na.locf(match(cumhaz$time,cumhazYes$time), na.rm = FALSE)]
cumhaz$chSpidersNo <- cumhazNo$cumhaz[na.locf(match(cumhaz$time,cumhazNo$time), na.rm = FALSE)]
```


```{r}
attach(cumhaz)

plot(time, chSpidersYes, type = "s", ylab = "cumulative hazard", xlab = "time")
lines(time, chSpidersNo, type = "s", lty= 2)

plot(time, log(chSpidersYes), type = "s", ylab = "log(cumulative hazard)", xlab = "time")
lines(time, log(chSpidersNo), type = "s", lty= 2)

plot(time, log(chSpidersYes) - log(chSpidersNo), type = "s", ylab = "log(ratio cumulative hazard)", xlab = "time")

plot(chSpidersNo, chSpidersYes, type = "s", ylab = "cumulative hazard spiders=Yes", xlab = "cumulative hazard spiders=No")
```
##b) Parametric regression models
```{r}
#see exercise session 2 recording at 2:19:30
fit_weibull <- survreg(Surv(years, status2)~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
        data = pbc2,
        dist = 'weibull')
fit_exp <- survreg(Surv(years, status2)~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
        data = pbc2,
        dist = 'exponential')
fit_loglog <- survreg(Surv(years, status2)~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
        data = pbc2,
        dist = 'loglogistic')
fit_lognorm <- survreg(Surv(years, status2)~ drug + age + sex + ascites + hepatomegaly + spiders + edema + serBilir + serChol + albumin + alkaline + SGOT,
        data = pbc2,
        dist = 'lognormal')
```

```{r}
#Model selection on AIC criteria
AIC <- c(extractAIC(fit_weibull)[2],extractAIC(fit_exp)[2],extractAIC(fit_loglog)[2],extractAIC(fit_lognorm)[2])
names(AIC) <- c('weibul','exponential', 'loglogistic', 'lognormal')
AIC
#lowest AIC is loglogistic, so it should be the one selected
```
```{r}
#specifications of selected model
summary(fit_loglog)
```
